body:
My grandpa was old school--or so we thought. That's how it came off. He never bought a car over $300--he looked like he got his clothes from the Salvation Army bin, for free---they had a small farm, and every year would slaughter a pig or 2 and have them cut at the local butcher shop for a small fee. My g'ma still wore her clothes from the 70's-80's when she died. All she ever wanted was to travel a little. I'm not talking 20K trips to Europe. She wanted to see Natural Bridge, VA, and maybe D.C once, and go visit family in SC. But no. He would never allow that. He didn't drive over 45 mph EVER (because it saved gas?), which almost killed me once when I was a little kid, btw, when I rode with them instead of my parents (the only time he left his hometown, much less the state, btw). That man could pinch a penny until it screamed for mercy and bled real blood. 

When he died, we found out my grand'pa was a real estate mogul. No, not a millionaire, but he wasn't poor. He had hundreds of thousand in the bank and owned 5 or 6 properties in "town" he rented out for income, all of them paid in full years before. He could have afforded to take my grand'ma to fucking SC on vacation to visit her cousin, or bought her a decent car to get around in, at least. Maybe some pretty dresses. But he didn't. Because he was a miserly cheapskate asshole. 

Marriage is a two way street. It's partnership. It's about trust, and being there for one another. It's a Union of two people who trust each other implicitly and work toward making one another Happy, fulfilled, and secure. It should be about being best friends for life. My grandma worked her ass off on the farm her whole life thinking they couldn't do any better on his salary as a carpenter and farmer. She slaughtered her own chickens and worked from sun up until past sunset taking care of her vegetables and caring for her chickens, cooking 3 meals a day for him---on a wood stove. She cooked on a wood stove because he was too fucking cheap to pay for gas. And she thought that was how things were. And she loved him anyway. And for 60+years of her life, her deadbeat, selfish, no good, cheap skate husband was hiding income from her that could have made her life easier and more fulfilling. 

Do not tell me about all your fucking selfish MGTOW and incel bullshit. If you marry someone, you should trust them. You should want what's best for them....you should want them to be happy and fulfilled. If you're hiding your money from them and acting like they're some kind of gold digger---first, Why the fuck are you with them? And two....You're a selfish piece of shit. I hope your money keeps you warm in your grave, you miserly, selfish asshole. 

She's better off without this selfish piece of garbage. Guarantee, if she had a high paying job and they married, he'd have lived off of her and hid his income anyway, making her think he had nothing while she supported HIM. And he would have actually justified this. He would have made it sound like he was doing HER a favor.....because that's how selfish people are. 

If you need a prenup----you either need to reevaluate your priorities---or reevaluate who you're marrying. 

What is money for but to make the people you love happier? What are you going to do? Die with it? Take it with you? Good luck with that.

parent.body:
My grandpa was old school--or so we thought. That's how it came off. He never bought a car over $300--he looked like he got his clothes from the Salvation Army bin, for free---they had a small farm, and every year would slaughter a pig or 2 and have them cut at the local butcher shop for a small fee. My g'ma still wore her clothes from the 70's-80's when she died. All she ever wanted was to travel a little. I'm not talking 20K trips to Europe. She wanted to see Natural Bridge, VA, and maybe D.C once, and go visit family in SC. But no. He would never allow that. He didn't drive over 45 mph EVER (because it saved gas?), which almost killed me once when I was a little kid, btw, when I rode with them instead of my parents (the only time he left his hometown, much less the state, btw). That man could pinch a penny until it screamed for mercy and bled real blood. 

When he died, we found out my grand'pa was a real estate mogul. No, not a millionaire, but he wasn't poor. He had hundreds of thousand in the bank and owned 5 or 6 properties in "town" he rented out for income, all of them paid in full years before. He could have afforded to take my grand'ma to fucking SC on vacation to visit her cousin, or bought her a decent car to get around in, at least. Maybe some pretty dresses. But he didn't. Because he was a miserly cheapskate asshole. 

Marriage is a two way street. It's partnership. It's about trust, and being there for one another. It's a Union of two people who trust each other implicitly and work toward making one another Happy, fulfilled, and secure. It should be about being best friends for life. My grandma worked her ass off on the farm her whole life thinking they couldn't do any better on his salary as a carpenter and farmer. She slaughtered her own chickens and worked from sun up until past sunset taking care of her vegetables and caring for her chickens, cooking 3 meals a day for him---on a wood stove. She cooked on a wood stove because he was too fucking cheap to pay for gas. And she thought that was how things were. And she loved him anyway. And for 60+years of her life, her deadbeat, selfish, no good, cheap skate husband was hiding income from her that could have made her life easier and more fulfilling. 

Do not tell me about all your fucking selfish MGTOW and incel bullshit. If you marry someone, you should trust them. You should want what's best for them....you should want them to be happy and fulfilled. If you're hiding your money from them and acting like they're some kind of gold digger---first, Why the fuck are you with them? And two....You're a selfish piece of shit. I hope your money keeps you warm in your grave, you miserly, selfish asshole. 

She's better off without this selfish piece of garbage. Guarantee, if she had a high paying job and they married, he'd have lived off of her and hid his income anyway, making her think he had nothing while she supported HIM. And he would have actually justified this. He would have made it sound like he was doing HER a favor.....because that's how selfish people are. 

If you need a prenup----you either need to reevaluate your priorities---or reevaluate who you're marrying. 

What is money for but to make the people you love happier? What are you going to do? Die with it? Take it with you? Good luck with that.

parent.body:
My grandpa was old school--or so we thought. That's how it came off. He never bought a car over $300--he looked like he got his clothes from the Salvation Army bin, for free---they had a small farm, and every year would slaughter a pig or 2 and have them cut at the local butcher shop for a small fee. My g'ma still wore her clothes from the 70's-80's when she died. All she ever wanted was to travel a little. I'm not talking 20K trips to Europe. She wanted to see Natural Bridge, VA, and maybe D.C once, and go visit family in SC. But no. He would never allow that. He didn't drive over 45 mph EVER (because it saved gas?), which almost killed me once when I was a little kid, btw, when I rode with them instead of my parents (the only time he left his hometown, much less the state, btw). That man could pinch a penny until it screamed for mercy and bled real blood. 

When he died, we found out my grand'pa was a real estate mogul. No, not a millionaire, but he wasn't poor. He had hundreds of thousand in the bank and owned 5 or 6 properties in "town" he rented out for income, all of them paid in full years before. He could have afforded to take my grand'ma to fucking SC on vacation to visit her cousin, or bought her a decent car to get around in, at least. Maybe some pretty dresses. But he didn't. Because he was a miserly cheapskate asshole. 

Marriage is a two way street. It's partnership. It's about trust, and being there for one another. It's a Union of two people who trust each other implicitly and work toward making one another Happy, fulfilled, and secure. It should be about being best friends for life. My grandma worked her ass off on the farm her whole life thinking they couldn't do any better on his salary as a carpenter and farmer. She slaughtered her own chickens and worked from sun up until past sunset taking care of her vegetables and caring for her chickens, cooking 3 meals a day for him---on a wood stove. She cooked on a wood stove because he was too fucking cheap to pay for gas. And she thought that was how things were. And she loved him anyway. And for 60+years of her life, her deadbeat, selfish, no good, cheap skate husband was hiding income from her that could have made her life easier and more fulfilling. 

Do not tell me about all your fucking selfish MGTOW and incel bullshit. If you marry someone, you should trust them. You should want what's best for them....you should want them to be happy and fulfilled. If you're hiding your money from them and acting like they're some kind of gold digger---first, Why the fuck are you with them? And two....You're a selfish piece of shit. I hope your money keeps you warm in your grave, you miserly, selfish asshole. 

She's better off without this selfish piece of garbage. Guarantee, if she had a high paying job and they married, he'd have lived off of her and hid his income anyway, making her think he had nothing while she supported HIM. And he would have actually justified this. He would have made it sound like he was doing HER a favor.....because that's how selfish people are. 

If you need a prenup----you either need to reevaluate your priorities---or reevaluate who you're marrying. 

What is money for but to make the people you love happier? What are you going to do? Die with it? Take it with you? Good luck with that.

It would be interesting to hear his side of things though from her description, it sounds like she cares far more about what other people think and how she appears than he does. 

Why did she feel low after finding out that he is wealthy? It shouldn’t change their incompatibility and it shouldn’t change her mind about breaking up with him.

If he has to “treat her” to keep their relationship alive, it’s destined to fail anyway.

body:
Very based point of view. People like to take the emotional triggering aspect as absolute fact, but they don't read between the lines. She basically ratted herself out. 

> He never took me to **fancy dinners** 

I've done that, and what a waste of money. It's a snowball situation, if he gives her what she wants here, it'll turn into "Omg that was so awesome! Let's do that again!" And again, and again, until it's every weekend. 

> He insisted on pre-drinking and would never buy drinks at a bar

He set a standard and stuck to it. Bars are another hemorrhage on one's finances. Same rule applies, it's like drug addiction. Start off small as recreational, next thing you know, life can't be fun without it. It's this decadent lifestyle that costs people their livelihoods. Like a gambling junky. You're going to be chasing that dopamine for the rest of your life, and no amount of money spent will obtain it. 

> After seeing a girl from high school buy her 3rd property with her husband, it felt like my relationship was juvenile and had no future. 

There it is, keeping up with The Jones'. Buy more, now! So if he did, where does that road end? Envy is a deadly sin, as well as the love of money. 

> With prior boyfriends, we would still text/talk a bit, and even still hook up. 

I wonder if her *current* boyfriend knew about that... 

> I was at the gym today 

Shopping? 

> I saw two of Will's friends and decided to make small talk 

Wearing what? Seems to me she's only looking for the highest bidder. I'm sorry, but in 10 months she never tried bringing up marriage? Buying a house? Having kids? What did she ever do *for him*? She could have splurged on him too, but no details of that sort. It's all "Me! Me! Me!" with her. I'd love to hear his side, but I'd bet he isn't so petty as to air out his dirty laundry online for pitty points.

People like nice things and don’t want to live a life of poverty and struggle? People want their life to progress and evolve? People expect being with a partner to *improve* their quality of life? People acknowledge that Will’s wealth is wasted on him?

How dare they. 

Damn “gold-diggers” and their not liking aimless males who live impoverished lives. Damn females not liking useless males.

This idea that females are just supposed to like males for “them” is stupid. Males are generally unattractive in the first place and they take up space and insert themselves into everything. They are often burdensome to entertain and interact with. If you think differently, why don’t you go marry one yourself. Females like males for social status and quality of life they can’t otherwise get for themselves. That’s not “gold-digging,” that’s the nature and tradition you guys worship.

These people get mad when females want partners that will improve their lives and will spend money on them, YET they expect females to be jumping at the bit to get married when clearly the only way a female could live her best life with the way these guys want the world perpetuated is to get a job and forego husbands completely. Then, they’re mad at that too.

You don’t get it both ways. You don’t get to resign females to shitty fates and wasted lives.

If you’re a straight man, you work, you build things, you give your money to your wife to manage, and then you die. That is your purpose. That is nature. You are valuable because you work and generate income - that is the only reason to marry you, not “you.” Stop bitching about it.

If you want to hoard all your money for no reason at all, then don’t get married. Simple. The state will be happy to collect the profits of your failed life.

body:
There’s so much I disagree with in this comment but I’ll keep this short.

Not all women see themselves as damsels in distress who need a husband to save them. We’re not helpless and retarded.

Also, not all women see wealth in the same way you do. You don’t get to decide how someone else spends their money.

It sounds like this woman would not be happy even if she knew about the money because then he still wouldn’t be spending it on what she believed he should be spending it on.

parent.body:
People like nice things and don’t want to live a life of poverty and struggle? People want their life to progress and evolve? People expect being with a partner to *improve* their quality of life? People acknowledge that Will’s wealth is wasted on him?

How dare they. 

Damn “gold-diggers” and their not liking aimless males who live impoverished lives. Damn females not liking useless males.

This idea that females are just supposed to like males for “them” is stupid. Males are generally unattractive in the first place and they take up space and insert themselves into everything. They are often burdensome to entertain and interact with. If you think differently, why don’t you go marry one yourself. Females like males for social status and quality of life they can’t otherwise get for themselves. That’s not “gold-digging,” that’s the nature and tradition you guys worship.

These people get mad when females want partners that will improve their lives and will spend money on them, YET they expect females to be jumping at the bit to get married when clearly the only way a female could live her best life with the way these guys want the world perpetuated is to get a job and forego husbands completely. Then, they’re mad at that too.

You don’t get it both ways. You don’t get to resign females to shitty fates and wasted lives.

If you’re a straight man, you work, you build things, you give your money to your wife to manage, and then you die. That is your purpose. That is nature. You are valuable because you work and generate income - that is the only reason to marry you, not “you.” Stop bitching about it.

If you want to hoard all your money for no reason at all, then don’t get married. Simple. The state will be happy to collect the profits of your failed life.

body: Can a girl do whatever she wants? No, but she can get away with a great deal more than a boy can. You don't really notice it however, because our perception is biased by our primal instincts before we even have time to process it; your brain has already determined that a crying woman is in a rough place and needs sympathy, and your brain has already determined that a crying man is just a violent mean piece of shit, before you even have time to think about it. Don't lie, this is what literally everyone thinks. Our brains are designed not to weigh these situations based on the facts, but on how it looks at first glance, and unfortunately this forms most of our opinion of something. And one of the metrics our minds use is how "cute" or "innocent" someone looks. And as the female is more valuable to nature due to the way reproduction works, they develop cuter and more innocent looking bodies and faces, so that they will attract more sympathy and protection. The male is the expendable machine designed not for himself but to provide for the female, and as such they develop to look more ugly and mean. They're also most desirable as someone who will sacrifice themselves for the woman, and as such are generally not regarded as having the right to burden others by complaining about their own problems. There are very simple and logical biological reasons for these trends and that's what's at fault here. It's not as if people say to themselves "I'm going to worship women and all men are bad and I hate them and they deserve to be hated". It's just how we're hardwired to respond to these sorts of stimuli.
